name: Lieutenant Monroe
detailed_location: Boulder CityDid not betray Monroe:Camp Forlorn Hope

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: We've got a situation with some Great Khans right now. The brass at McCarran has ordered me to lock down the ruins until it's been resolved.

topics.topic_text: How much money would it take for you to look the other way while the Great Khans left?
topics.response_text: You mean... just let them go? How would I explain this to my superiors?

topics.topic_text: These Great Khans might have something of mine - a Platinum Chip.
topics.response_text: Once the Great Khans have been killed or captured, you're welcome to retrieve any property they've taken from you.

topics.topic_text: Look at it this way - nobody dies.
topics.response_text: 500 caps would go a long way for some soldier's families.

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Forget I said anything.
topics.response_text: Right.

topics.topic_text: Done. Here's the caps.
topics.response_text: This doesn't feel quite right, but it resolves things and gets my troopers back in one piece.

topics.topic_text: I'll be back with the caps.
topics.response_text: All right.

topics.topic_text: The Great Khans let the hostages go in exchange for their own freedom.
topics.response_text: My hands are tied. I can't go against orders... can I?

topics.topic_text: Go for it. The Great Khans have nowhere to run.
topics.response_text: You cut a deal with the Khans? Damn it. Attacking them now doesn't feel right, but orders are orders.

topics.topic_text: 400 caps is a less suspicious amount. You have enough trouble here as it is.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] That makes sense, and it's still more than these troopers see in a month.

topics.topic_text: What's going on with the Great Khans?
topics.response_text: One of my patrols was on its way back from Novac when it came under fire from the Great Khans.

topics.topic_text: You're the officer here. Make the call.
topics.response_text: I don't like it, but orders are orders.

topics.topic_text: Here's the caps.
topics.response_text: This doesn't feel quite right, but it resolves things and gets my troopers back in one piece.

topics.topic_text: I'm still working on it.
topics.response_text: Very well. Keep me updated.

topics.topic_text: About that bribe...
topics.response_text: 500 caps was the amount requested.

topics.topic_text: If you have any integrity, then you'll honor the deal.
topics.response_text: You're right. The Great Khans are free to go.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: {nodding}Goodbye.

topics.topic_text: Forget what I said. Kill them all.
topics.response_text: I don't like it, but orders are orders.

topics.topic_text: Can I ask you some questions?
topics.response_text: Shoot.

topics.topic_text: <Lie> I didn't have a choice - they started shooting first.
topics.response_text: Knowing the Khans, they were probably drugged up to hell and back.{Not quite believing the player, but not really having any evidence to the contrary.}

topics.topic_text: Like you said, things went bad.
topics.response_text: Right... probably just bad luck.{Somewhat disbelieving - he knows the player isn't telling the whole truth.}

topics.topic_text: That was me, "negotiating."
topics.response_text: You were supposed to negotiate for the safety of my troopers, damn it.{Controlled anger - he trusted the player to handle things diplomatically, and the player started a fight instead.}

topics.topic_text: I may be able to negotiate a deal with the Great Khans.
topics.response_text: Normally, I'd turn you down since I have no idea who you are, but considering that the hostages are as good as dead when we attack...

topics.topic_text: I could sneak in there and try to get your people out.
topics.response_text: As soon as you free them, the rest of my squad will move in and provide covering fire.

topics.topic_text: I understand.
topics.response_text: Good luck.

topics.topic_text: What are you going to do about the hostages?
topics.response_text: Acceptable casualties, I've been told. I don't like it, but the brass has their reasons.

topics.topic_text: I'm unable to work out a deal. The Great Khans are all yours.
topics.response_text: It was worth a try. I'll have to proceed with the attack as ordered, then.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: All right.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about Hoover Dam?
topics.response_text: It's one of the biggest sources of electrical power in the region, so the NCR's fortified the place pretty heavily.

topics.topic_text: Is there anything you can tell me about the Great Khans?
topics.response_text: They're an outlaw group, primarily trafficking in drugs and other contraband. They usually stay out of NCR territory, though.

topics.topic_text: Where can I find McCarran?
topics.response_text: Camp McCarran is the headquarters for the NCR military in this region. It occupies the old airport next to New Vegas.

topics.topic_text: The President is coming to Hoover Dam?
topics.response_text: It's probably just a political thing - you know, give a few speeches, shake hands with the troops, boost morale.

topics.topic_text: What happened to Boulder City?
topics.response_text: Destroyed during the Battle of Hoover Dam a couple of years ago. The town was set up as a trap for Caesar's Legion.{Spoken with pride about a significant victory.}

description:
Lieutenant Monroe is a 34 year-old Caucasian Male.

A seasoned officer in the New California Republic's standing army, Lieutenant Monroe is a disciplined and no-nonsense military man who has been coordinating patrols and combat operations in the eastern Mojave Wasteland for several years. With a sharp uniform and a stern demeanor, Monroe commands respect from his troops and is known for his strict adherence to military protocol and chain of command.

Lieutenant Monroe's Personality: Disciplined, methodical, and strictly by-the-book. Lieutenant Monroe values order and military hierarchy above all else. He is pragmatic in his decision-making, often prioritizing mission objectives over personal feelings. While not inherently cruel, his rigid adherence to regulations can make him appear cold and uncompromising to those outside the military structure.

Lieutenant Monroe's Backstory: Born and raised in the NCR capital of Shady Sands, Monroe came from a family with a long history of military service. Following in his father's footsteps, he enlisted in the NCR Army at the age of 18 and quickly distinguished himself through his discipline and tactical acumen. Over the years, he rose through the ranks, serving in various postings across the NCR territories before being assigned to the Mojave front. His experience in the harsh wasteland has only reinforced his belief in the importance of military structure and the NCR's mission to bring civilization to the region.
